title: JD Vance Slams Zelenskyy, Criticizes US Visit Amid Ukraine Conflict
text:
[+](javascipt:void(0);)
During a recent interview with The New Yorker, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy labeled JD Vance, Ohio Senator and Donald Trumpâ€™s 2024 running mate, as â€œtoo radical.â€ Zelenskyy was responding to Vanceâ€™s suggestion to resolve the Russia-Ukraine conflict with a deal where Ukraine remains neutral, avoiding alliances like NATO.
Zelenskyy rejected the proposal, referring to lessons from World War II, and suggesting that Vance should â€œdo some readingâ€ about the dangers of appeasement.
Zelensky called JD Vance â€œtoo radical.â€
Vance fired back at Zelensky for what came off as campaigning, saying, â€œI donâ€™t appreciate Zelensky coming to this country and telling the American taxpayers what they oughta do. He oughta say thank you to the American taxpayers.â€ ğŸ‘ğŸ»

[September 26, 2024]
During a campaign rally in Traverse City, Michigan, JD Vance hit back at Zelenskyyâ€™s comments. He clarified that his idea, discussed on the Shawn Ryan Show podcast, was just â€œone possible scenario,â€ not an official plan.
However, Vance voiced his displeasure with Zelenskyyâ€™s US visit, criticizing the Ukrainian leader for â€œtelling the American taxpayer what they ought to doâ€ after receiving substantial US financial and military aid. He suggested Zelenskyy should show more gratitude to the American people.
JD Vance also highlighted former President Donald Trumpâ€™s stance on Ukraine, claiming that under Trumpâ€™s leadership, Russia did not attack Ukraine. He criticized the current Democratic administration for its failure to deter Russian aggression, attributing this to â€œweak and dumbâ€ leadership. Vance reiterated Trumpâ€™s promise to resolve the Ukraine conflict within â€œ24 hoursâ€ if re-elected in 2024.
